venue.address_2: Travel 3.1 miles west on Passaconaway/Dugway Road
venue.name: South Moat Mountain

item.description:
If interested in the following, please put yourself on the established waiting list. A yes list will be provided as soon as possible.

All attendees must read, understand and agree to the waiver/liability as outlined by this website.




We will meet at the Moat Mtn Trailhead (south).

The trailhead is located on Dugway Rd. At the lights in Conway village, turn north (directly opposite NH 153) onto Washington St., which becomes West Side Rd. Go left at a fork, then at 0.9 mi. turn left on Passaconaway Rd., which becomes Dugway Rd. The Moat Mountain Trail (sign) leaves Dugway Rd. at a new trailhead parking area on the right, 4.1 mi. from Conway.

We will spot cars here and carpool over to the Moat Mtn Trailhead (northeast).

Total distance is 9.5 miles
Book time is 6:30

starting at Moat Mtn Trailhead (northeast) 44° 04' 28" 71° 09' 51"
This trail traverses the main ridge of Moat Mountain, providing
magnificent views from numerous outlooks. The northeast
terminus of the trail is reached from Conway village via
Washington St. and West Side Rd., or from North Conway (at a
point just north of the Eastern Slope Inn) by following River Rd.
west for 1.0 mi. across the Saco River to West Side Rd. Once on
West Side Rd., drive north for another 1.4 mi. to a large parking
lot on the west side of the road.
0.57 mi 19 min +39 ft on Moat Mtn Trail
0.57 mi 19 min +39 ft This trail traverses the main ridge of Moat Mountain, providing
magnificent views from numerous outlooks. Parts of the ridge are
very exposed to weather, particularly the section that crosses
Middle Moat and South Moat. The trail can be hard to follow along
the open ridge sections in poor visibility conditions—look carefully
for blazes, which may be faded.
Starting from the northeast terminus, a wide, graded,
handicapped-accessible path descends slightly then turns left and
winds through coniferous woods, intersecting the former route (a
gravel road) at the clearing just below the mill site at Diana’s
Baths, a series of scenic cascades where Lucy Brook runs over
ledges and through large potholes.
to Dianas Baths 44° 04' 18" 71° 10' 12"
0.63 mi 25 min +153 ft on Moat Mtn Trail
1.20 mi 44 min +192 ft The Moat Mountain Trail leaves the upper end of the clearing,
close to the baths, by a logging road that follows the north bank of
Lucy Brook to a fork (sign). Here the Red Ridge Trail turns left
across the brook, eventually rejoining the Moat Mountain Trail at
the apex of Red Ridge, making possible a fine loop hike.
to the junction of Red Ridge Trail 44° 04' 03" 71° 10' 40"
1.20 mi 46 min +328 ft on Moat Mtn Trail
2.40 mi 1 hr 30 min +521 ft The Moat Mountain Trail crosses Lucy Brook (difficult at high
water), and follows the south bank, then turns abruptly left uphill,
away from the stream (last sure water), at the point where the
Attitash Trail continues straight ahead along the stream toward
Big Attitash Mountain.
to the junction of Attitash Trail 44° 03' 51" 71° 12' 01"
1.90 mi 2 hr 1 min +2125 ft on Moat Mtn Trail
4.30 mi 3 hr 31 min +2646 ft The Moat Mountain Trail ascends through the woods, and begins
to pass over ledgy areas, reaching the first good outlook. It
reaches a shoulder and runs nearly level through a patch of larger
trees, then climbs fairly steeply through decreasing scrub and
increasing bare ledge to the summit of North Moat, where there is
an unobstructed view in all directions.
to North Moat Mtn 44° 02' 35" 71° 12' 52"
1.10 mi 37 min -437 ft on Moat Mtn Trail
5.40 mi 4 hr 8 min +2209 ft From the summit of North Moat, the trail descends sharply to the
base of the cone, then easily along a shoulder with occasional
views. At the end of the shoulder it drops steeply, passing over
several ledges that require some scrambling, traverses another
shoulder where there is a fine outlook to the right in a ledgy area,
then descends to a col in a fine spruce forest. Ascending again, it
passes the junction with the Red Ridge Trail left (east), just below
several large rocks that provide good views.
to the junction of Red Ridge Trail 44° 02' 01" 71° 12' 16"
1.60 mi 1 hr 3 min +7 ft on Moat Mtn Trail
7.00 mi 5 hr 11 min +2216 ft The trail descends to the major col on the ridge, then climbs up to
low scrub followed by open ledges with continuous views, and
passes east of the summit of Middle Moat (which can be reached
in 80 yd. over open ledges). The trail descends to a minor col with
a patch of woods that would provide some shelter in a storm, then
ascends to the summit of South Moat.
to South Moat Mtn 44° 01' 03" 71° 11' 37"
2.50 mi 1 hr 19 min -2098 ft on Moat Mtn Trail
2
Distance Time Elev
Change
Trail / Waypoint Latitude Longitude
9.50 mi 6 hr 30 min +118 ft The trail then descends into scrub and gradually increasing
numbers of beautiful red pines, with views decreasing in
frequency. The trail passes an outlook to Mt. Chocorua, and the
trail becomes steep with rough footing. Below this section, the
grade eases considerably, and then the trail turns right onto a
wide, well-constructed relocation. It runs generally west at easy
grades, crosses Dry Brook on a bridge, swings left and then right
over a small ridge, and crosses a small brook. It climbs over
another low ridge, then turns sharp left onto a logging road and
leads past a gate to the parking area on Passaconaway Rd.
to Moat Mtn Trailhead (south) 43° 59' 38" 71° 11' 01"
This trail traverses the main ridge of Moat Mountain, providing
magnificent views from numerous outlooks. The south terminus of
the trail is located on Dugway Rd. At the lights in Conway village,
turn north (directly opposite NH 153) onto Washington St., which
becomes West Side Rd. Go left at a fork, then at 0.9 mi. turn left
on Passaconaway Rd., which becomes Dugway Rd. The Moat
Mountain Trail (sign) leaves Dugway Rd. at a new trailhead
parking area on the right, 4.1 mi. from Conway. Dugway Rd.
continues and joins the Kancamagus Highway near Blackberry
Crossing Campground (but the west part of Dugway Rd. is closed
to vehicles from November to May).
9.50 mi 6 hr 30 min +118 ft Totals
item.how_to_find_us: WE WILL BE IN A SILVER SUBARU
item.name: MOAT MOUNTAINS TRAVERSE
